flawed_nl_solution:
There were 90/3 = <<90/3=30>>30 lollipops.
So, 90 - 30 = <<90-30=56>>56 are candy canes.
Each boy received 3 lollipops, so there were 30/3 = 10 boys.
Each girl received 2 candy canes, so there were 56/2 = 28 girls.
Altogether, there were 10 + 28 = <<10+28=38>>38 boys and girls.
#### 38

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 60, not 56. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
